title: Lemon-Tahini Slaw
ingredients: 1tablespoon fresh lemon zest plus 5 tablespoons lemon juice (from 2 to 3 lemons)
1medium Savoy or other green cabbage (1 1/2 to 2 pounds), cored and thinly sliced
1tablespoon Dijon mustard, plus more to taste
3large or 6 small radishes, cut into matchsticks
directions: Chop and smash the capers, lemon zest and half the scallions together into a coarse, wet paste. In a large bowl, combine the cabbage, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon salt and the scallion-caper mixture. Massage with your hands until the cabbage is slightly wilted.

Prepare the dressing: In a liquid measuring cup, stir together the remaining 1/4 cup lemon juice, the tahini and mustard. Add water until thick but pourable (about 3 tablespoons depending on tahini brand). Season to taste with salt and pepper and another teaspoon of mustard for more kick, if desired.

Add the snap peas, radishes and remaining scallions to the cabbage, then stir in enough dressing to lightly coat. (Leftover dressing will keep for up to a week; thin with water as needed.) Season slaw to taste with salt and pepper.
